titleStmt.title: Andrew Scott to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5035

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Commonwealth of Ky-

Your Petition Andrew Scott would most respectfully represent that he was find at the late term of the Trimble Circuit Court May term 1864 in the Sum of Twenty Dollars for pitching Dollars or Quoits in the town of Bedford, and persons by having bet on him without his knowledge or consent, He would therefore represent that he was ignorant of the fact, that he was liable to a fine
He would therefore pray your honor to remit said fine or as much thereof as your honor would in your clemency see proper and in duty bound will ever pray &c &c
We the undersigned citizens of Trimble county Kentucky Join the petition in his prayer above

S. Gatewood
W F Adcock
Rankin Walsh (of the Jury)
James Sams
F. E. Skidmore
Geo W Pryor
Willis Oliver
A. J. Wright
Shed Barnes Jr
Robt Frost
Wm Stanley
J F Pittmore
W P Maddox
W. Stratton

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
A. Scott
Gaming

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
